channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Rep. Adam Smith shares his concerns about the U.S. boat strikes near Venezuela
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Rep. Adam Smith, the top Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, about the questions he has surrounding the U.S. military strikes on boats near Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Rep. Adam Smith, the top Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, about the questions he has surrounding the U.S. military strikes on boats near Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Trump eyes next steps with Venezuela as lawmakers raise alarms about boat strikes
item.description: President Trump met with his advisors Monday to discuss next steps with Venezuela as lawmakers continue to raise concerns about the administration's military strikes on boats in the Caribbean Sea.
item.content:encoded: President Trump met with his advisors Monday to discuss next steps with Venezuela as lawmakers continue to raise concerns about the administration's military strikes on boats in the Caribbean Sea.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: In deep red Tennessee district, race for vacant congressional seat could be tight
item.description: Tennessee is a Republican stronghold, but the results of a special congressional election Tuesday will likely show whether Democrats can flip a seat held by the GOP for decades.
item.content:encoded: Tennessee is a Republican stronghold, but the results of a special congressional election Tuesday will likely show whether Democrats can flip a seat held by the GOP for decades.
item.dc:creator: Marianna Bacallao

item.title: This company charges disabled vets millions, even after VA said it's likely illegal
item.description: A Florida-based company is charging military veterans as much as $20,000 for help with disability claims, even though the VA has said that may be illegal and the service should be free. But so far nobody's stopping the company and others like it.
item.content:encoded:
A Florida-based company is charging military veterans as much as $20,000 for help with disability claims, even though the VA has said that may be illegal and the service should be free. But so far nobody's stopping the company and others like it.

(Image credit: Via Dustin)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: Ailey dance company's new leader launches first season with 'fresh' vision
item.description: Alicia Graf Mack says her new role as artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is like coming full circle after a stint as principal dancer for the beloved group.
item.content:encoded:
Alicia Graf Mack says her new role as artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is like coming full circle after a stint as principal dancer for the beloved group.

(Image credit: Andrew Eccles)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Pope Leo holds final mass in Lebanon, ending maiden trip to the Middle East
item.description: Pope Leo ended his first overseas trip Tuesday with a Mass along the Beirut waterfront.
item.content:encoded: Pope Leo ended his first overseas trip Tuesday with a Mass along the Beirut waterfront.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: ICE raids have deterred foreign farm workers, but farmers hope to make hiring easier
item.description: U.S. farms increasingly depend on foreign workers, but ICE raids have exacerbated the agriculture labor crisis. But some farmers want to make it easier to hire people from abroad using a visa program.
item.content:encoded: U.S. farms increasingly depend on foreign workers, but ICE raids have exacerbated the agriculture labor crisis. But some farmers want to make it easier to hire people from abroad using a visa program.
item.dc:creator: Frank Morris

item.title: How one tribal radio station is fighting to survive following federal funding cuts
item.description: Several dozen tribal radio stations were caught in the crossfire of federal funding cuts this fall. NPR's Frank Langfitt visited one station in Colorado navigating its survival.
item.content:encoded: Several dozen tribal radio stations were caught in the crossfire of federal funding cuts this fall. NPR's Frank Langfitt visited one station in Colorado navigating its survival.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Research finds nontraditional benefits may help retain young public health workers
item.description: New research from Columbia University suggests that nontraditional benefits, including flexible schedules and access to child care, may help keep public health workers under 35 on the job.
item.content:encoded: New research from Columbia University suggests that nontraditional benefits, including flexible schedules and access to child care, may help keep public health workers under 35 on the job.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Former NATO ambassador on whether Russia might consider the latest Ukraine peace deal
item.description: Will Russia accept a modified proposal to end the war in Ukraine? NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with former NATO Ambassador Kurt Volker.
item.content:encoded: Will Russia accept a modified proposal to end the war in Ukraine? NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with former NATO Ambassador Kurt Volker.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
